Package net.xqhs.flash.core.support

Interface MessagingShard

  • All Superinterfaces:
    AgentShard, net.xqhs.util.config.Configurable, ConfigurableEntity<Agent>, Entity<Agent>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractMessagingShard, AbstractNameBasedMessagingShard, LocalPylon.SimpleLocalMessaging, WebSocketMessagingShard
    public interface MessagingShard
extends AgentShard
    Interface for any shard offering messaging functionality to an entity.

    A message is a type of wave (implemented through AgentWave, generally considered to convey information between entities which may execute on different nodes or are more loosely coupled (e.g. agents, or agents and artifacts), as opposed to entities which are always found on the same node and are more tightly coupled (e.g. shards inside the same agent).

    Author:
    Andrei Olaru

    • Method Detail

      • sendMessage

        boolean sendMessage​(java.lang.String source,
                    java.lang.String target,
                    java.lang.String content)
        Sends a message to another agent, according to the specific implementation.
        Parameters:
        source - - the source (complete) endpoint of the message.
        target - - the target (complete) endpoint of the message.
        content - - the content of the message.
        Returns:
        true if the message was sent successfully.

      • getAgentAddress

        java.lang.String getAgentAddress()
        Returns:
        the address of this agent in the Pylon this shard is assigned to.

      • register

        void register​(java.lang.String entityName)
        Parameters:
        entityName - - the name of entity to be registered
